rComments: Never had a professor this incapable of being concise. Extremely disorganized lectures, hard to follow and filled with typos and contradictions. Be prepared to do a lot of your own research if you want to pass the course.

honestly just so rude and doesnt at all care about any of her students or the lecture material shes teaching. everytime you try to ask her a question she scowls at you and doesnt give you a direct yes or no answer. also talks wayyyyyyy too fast during lecture, doesnt give good examples of anything she just keeps babbling on and very dense lectures
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Lots of homework']

rComments: Honestly, I expected a lot more. Doesn't seem to care much about students, has ZERO humility and can't admit when she's made a mistake or graded something incorrectly and just fumbles over her own words trying to justify a grade because she doesn't want to change it. Lecture content flows logically, but again, not the greatest instructor at all.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Graded by few things', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: This professor talks WAY too fast during lecture. I barely have any time to write down what she is saying. Is always trying to get through the material an hour before lecture ends for some reason. Confusing too.
One of the worst professors I've ever had. She doesn't explain the course well and the lectures are very confusing. It's unfortunate that she is pretty much teaching every core courses in PCL.

It's so ironic that she kept telling students to be concise but her lecture slides are the full of repeating information (ex. 5 slides full of words could be talking about one concept that could be explained in just 1 slide). She got mad at students who found out mistakes in her test questions. And she always rushed through lectures.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: I feel she doesnt prepare for lectures, like she is reading the slides for the first time in class. I almost never wrote anything down, so I stopped showing up. I don't think PCL201 is particularly difficult, the content is relatively easy when you read it by yourself, I just dont think the lectures are presented well.
i dont understand all the poor review. Dr. Arnot is a great professor, and also very accessible outside of class. She is clear, and gets the job done.
Very approachable and extremely understanding.

She throws in tens of slides on which are mostly words per 2-hour lecture, rushes through materials, and sometimes say something opposite to what she really means. But she usually realizes it and starts over again. Test questions are hard, but manageable based on the knowledge from some BIO and BCH courses.

Great professor. Definitely had the most interesting lectures out of the three profs we had in PCL201. Lectures were fun to go to and she's also good at answering questions you approach her with. Maybe a little bit condescending-seeming at times but overall really good!
Condescending. Reads off slides.

okay I take back the review I made in Jan, 2016 for PCL302. Only had 5 lectures with her for that course, didn't know how confusing she could be when I have her for almost the entire semester. Her slides contradict themselves. Very disorganized, and doesn't make good use of slides. Talks A LOT, I MEAN I ALOT.

Doesn't explain lecture concepts well. Confusing and disorganized lecture slides. She does have office hours, however she is extremely condescending and not very straight forward when answering questions.   It's not impossible to get a good grade. The course makes you work for it but her presence would cause you to do alot more unnecessary work.
Unbelievably condescending when consulted. A generally bad prof.

She is very approachable. Her lectures are very interactive. If there's anything bad, it would be her voice but it's just a bit too high-pitched and it has nothing to do with her lecturing. The tests are okay, perhaps wording could improved a bit. Judging from the bad reviews, I assume she improved a lot this year.

I don't get the bad reviews, Arnot's a good prof. Material can be tough, but she answers questions well. Have no idea what an above commenter means when they say you have to know the whole textbook. I have taken almost every UofT PCL class (no tox tho).. None have req'd textbook readings, including Arnot's classes. Text was just optional reference.

In PCL302, teaching is not one of her strengths. She rushes through material and makes even easy material to be extremely difficult in the exam. Also, the most frustrating part is that she expects students to know the material at her level in exams. Advice 1: Avoid Her 2. Go memorize the whole pharm book (expected at the fourth year course)

Explanations- horrific, lecture slides - confusing, test-questions- detail oriented, challenging. She just confused me during lectures, looked and sounded unprepared and she just kept rambling on and on and on - never really making any sense. Good Luck enduring a semester of Dr.Arnot. I will never take a class she teaches again.
She just keep talking and talking in the class.

HORRIBLE prof. one of the worst profs at this university.  she lectures very poorly.  she doesn't seem to understand the material that well herself.  then she tests you on tiny details. she also has a horrible attitude.  people should avoid pcl just to avoid her.
HORRID.
Even a 1 is too good for her.
Even a 1 is too good for her. Need negative numbers to describe her horrid teaching and academic personality.

Teaching wise she isn't very good. She rushers though material too quickly and her slides aren't properly written leaving out important info. Tends to pick up tiny details for tests making them difficult instead of general more important concepts.
her tests ask horrible detail and she's pretty harsh and tough.  she doesn't bellcurve or display class averages.

Notes are a big disorganized, but an okay prof. Tests are a bit difficult compared to other courses, but fair. Could improve attitude in answering/responding to students' questions. Overall, an okay prof.
really bad and always want to punish students by giving out ridiculous test questions and unfair evaluation
Disorganized, tough/harsh, doesn't care abt the students. fast pace, TIME-CONSUMING course...and u might still not do too well!

Mean, unfair, overall incompetent lecturer. When I asked for clarification for something from the textbook, told me to ignore the book coz *she* was teaching the course, not the book. That about says it all.
